answers.text: the aerial warfare service branch of the United States Armed Forces

qas.question: How many uniformed services are there in the United States?
When did the USAF split from the US Army?
What is one of the functions of the USAF?

context: The United States Air Force (USAF) is <a0_0>the aerial warfare service branch of the United States Armed Forces<a0_0/> and one of the <a1_0>seven<a1_0/> American uniformed services. Initially part of the United States Army, the USAF was formed as a separate branch of the military on <a2_0>18 September 1947<a2_0/> under the <a3_0>National Security Act of 1947<a3_0/>. It is the most recent branch of the U.S. military to be formed, and is the largest and one of the world's most technologically advanced air forces. The USAF articulates its core functions as <a4_0>Nuclear Deterrence Operations<a4_0/>, Special Operations, Air Superiority, Global Integrated ISR, Space Superiority, Command and Control, Cyberspace Superiority, Personnel Recovery, Global Precision Attack, Building Partnerships, Rapid Global Mobility and Agile Combat Support.
